this is a great idea

Currently, I think the only way for redstone to travel through blocks is when a repeater is facing the block. As that always brings the redstone level to 15, each stage of oxidation may bring it down a certain level, allowing you to choose what level it is at more easily
Alternatively, copper blocks may reduce redstone levels when redstone goes over them
The redstone may be reduced by a fixed number of levels or by percentages
More oxidized blocks may reduce more redstone levels as they are more worn, or less oxidized blocks may do that as they are more conductive

Love this idea, being able to do this precisely and compactly (without having to build a network of comparators). Maybe Copper should connect to redstone like target blocks do on Java, 0ox works like any block being powered directly, 1ox does the same but reduces the level by 1, 2ox by 2, fully oxidized by 3.

On the topic of music, This is very important. I think there should be music for more than just bosses, the music should change depending on the environment. For example, if there is a storm, gloomy, organ music. In a village? Cheery banjo music, etc.
After defeating the boss has a rare chance to give you the music disc.

I feel like using real magic, like casting spells, summoning or controlling creatures, it would change too much the game. After all it is Minecraft not Minecastspellcraft. We woud no longer be miners and builders and crafters of things. Magic as we currently employ to enchant books, tools and weapons are sufficient. If there was a villager able to perform magic though, that would be cool, but not us. If we players are that versatile it's kind of OP. In fact the villagers should be the ones doing the enchanting for us like a service they are providing in a society that each people is good at something different. We mine, craft and build, they enchant stuff... and do their current other stuff too.

this could be amazing so in a big server you would be able to understand who texts without remembering their name, maybe their name could also change according to the assigned color from the new drop.
yes i agree
